thread.title: After unexpected week off, Chaparral storms past Boulder City - High School Sports News -
thread.title_full: After unexpected week off, Chaparral storms past Boulder City - High School Sports News - Las Vegas Sun News

author: Ray Brewer
title: After unexpected week off, Chaparral storms past Boulder City - High School Sports News -
text:
More Coverage Friday Night Roundup: Find out if your team won this week http://lasvegassun.com/news/2015/oct/08/once-a-gator-always-a-gator-henderson-bowl-rivalry/ High School Football Picks: Week 7 The Sun's high school football section The Chaparral High football team could have been sluggish today for its homecoming game against Boulder City .
Last week, the Cowboys were supposed to play Rancho, but the game was canceled after Rancho was forced to forfeit as penalty for a bench-clearing brawl in the previous week.
But Casey Acosta and his teammates made quick work of Boulder City. Acosta, a senior wide receiver, had a kickoff return for a touchdown and scored another touchdown on a screen pass in a 65-7 victory.
“Last week was very hard for the kids,” Chaparral coach Paul Nihipali said. “They thought they were being punished for doing nothing wrong. We had to be creative to make it exciting for them in practice, but they felt one week was taken from them.”
Boulder City led 7-0 but Chaparral scored 65 unanswered points to close the game. Andrew Solis had five touchdown passes for Chaparral, finding Kentrell Petite twice. Richard Nelson had three total scores.
Chaparral improves to 5-2 overall and 3-1 in the Sunrise League. Boulder City is winless in the Sunrise.
Ray Brewer can be reached at 702-990-2662 or ray.brewer@lasvegassun.com . Follow Ray on Twitter at twitter.com/raybrewer21
